Definition: Yellow fever is a viral disease transmitted by mosquitoes, characterized by fever, chills, loss of appetite, and muscle pain.
Causes: Infection with the yellow fever virus, primarily through mosquito bites.
Symptoms: Fever, chills, loss of appetite, muscle pain, and in severe cases, liver damage leading to jaundice.
Diagnosis: Clinical evaluation, blood tests, and serology.
Treatment: Supportive care; vaccination is the primary prevention method.
